item.title: To declare that certain agency actions by the National Labor Relations Board shall have no force or effect until final disposition is made in certain actions relating to the appointment of individuals to such Board that are pending in Federal court, and to prohibit further actions by such Board until such time.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions.

item.title: Preventing Greater Uncertainty in Labor-Management Relations Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.title: Preventing Greater Uncertainty in Labor-Management Relations Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 194 (Roll no. 98). (text: CR H1923)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 194 (Roll no. 98).(text: CR H1923)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H1930-1931)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 192 (Roll no. 97). (consideration: CR H1929, H1930)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 146.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1923-1929)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 15.
The resolution provides that an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of the Rules Committee Print 113-6 shall be considered as adopted.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1120 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-32, by Ms. Foxx.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-32, by Ms. Foxx.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1120) to prohibit the National Labor Relations Board from taking any action that requires a quorum of the members of the Board until such time as Board constituting a quorum shall have been confirmed by the Senate, the Supreme Court issues a decision on the constitutionality of the appointments to the Board made in January 2012, or the adjournment sine die of the first session of the 113th Congress.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1120) to prohibit the National Labor Relations Board from taking any action that requires a quorum of the members of the Board until such time as Board constituting a quorum shall have been confirmed by the Senate, the Supreme Court issues a decision on the constitutionality of the appointments to the Board made in January 2012, or the adjournment sine die of the first session of the 113th Congress.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
